name: CreateThread
description: Creates a new thread that runs asynchronously and in parallel with the main script execution. This allows for non-blocking operations and concurrent code execution.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The function to execute in the new thread

returns.description: This function does not return a value

example:
-- Basic thread creation
CreateThread(function()
    while true do
        print("This runs every 3 seconds")
        Wait(3000)
    end
end)

-- Multiple threads running in parallel
CreateThread(function()
    for i = 1, 10 do
        print("Thread 1: " .. i)
        Wait(1000)
    end
end)

CreateThread(function()
    for i = 1, 5 do
        print("Thread 2: " .. i)
        Wait(2000)
    end
end)

print("This executes immediately!")
notes: Threads run independently and don't block the main execution
Use Wait() inside threads to prevent infinite tight loops
Threads continue running until the script ends or an error occurs
